Together you will work on all aspects of a project, ranging from client contact to marketing to small administrative tasks. We are looking for someone with 1. Fluency in both Dutch and English; 2. A master’s degree in the field of health & life sciences; 3. Interest/affinity and preferably experience in: a. Value-Based Health Care and Value-Based Health Care implementation projects and education with a digital focus (a.o. e-health, data, AI) b. Digital transformation and services/products (internally and for clients); c. Business (a highly developed sense of commercialism and experience in marketing/communication); d. (Project) Management (planning skills, able to prioritize and work within deadlines, keeping an overview in hectic surroundings); e. Client relations and adding value for them; f. Willingness to work internationally; g. Consulting and change management experience or proven interest; 4. The following competencies: a. Positive and enthusiastic; b. Thorough; c. Hands-on mentality; d. Entrepreneurial and independent; 5. Excellent skills in MS Office.  What we offer 1. Fast-learning by doing; 2. Informal but professional and challenging surroundings; 3. Critical feedback loops to get the most out of you; 4. Working closely together in a team with great colleagues; 5. Freedom and responsibility; ‘head-first’, initiative and creativity; 6. All can build the company, you are important! How to apply Interested? Please send your application, together with your CV and a recent list of grades to info@thedecisiongroup.nl or call +31 (0)20 4040 111 for more information.

SENIOR RESEARCH ANALYST  Newzoo is the global leader in games and esports analytics and research. We work with the biggest and best names in the global games, media, and hardware industries, such as Wargaming, Google, and Nvidia. Performing consumer research for clients within these markets is one of our core activities as a market intelligence firm. As a Senior Research Analyst, you will work directly together with these companies, making sure that their needs are satisfied by carrying out syndicated and bespoke research. Your daily tasks will include managing research projects from start to finish, performing data analyses, preparing client presentations, and engaging with clients during calls.  Who we are looking for  You are self-motivated and thrive in a dynamic environment, have a critical and analytical mindset, excellent social skills, and are always looking for new ways to improve our research methodology. You will work in a fast-paced environment with a team and individually to design, propose and execute primary research projects related to the gaming industry. You will be responsible for owning the projects and leading junior members to deliver high quality projects to clients. It is important that you have extensive work experience with quantitative research and a clear affinity with the internet and digital media (a strong interest in video games in particular is a plus). Experience with qualitative research is also a plus.  Your Responsibilities:  As a project lead you will be managing and conducting multiple syndicated and custom research projects, tailored to our clients’ needs, from start to finish; Leading kick-off calls, and scoping the research set-up with clients, Running client analyses and creating client specific PowerPoint reports based on custom analysis of the data; Present results of market research in a story-driven and graphically appealing manner; Ensure timely and quality deliverables and services to clients; Working with the sales team and client team and other Senior Research Analysts you will be responsible for preparing and pitching to clients. You will explore research feasibility and prepare research cost estimates for clients. Develop custom tailored proposals describing research approach/recommendations; Present research pitches to clients; Guide and support junior teammates assigned to your projects and check outputs Collaborate with the various external and internal teams to deliver research projects; Analyze data from various sources, including our primary consumer research in 32 countries, data streams from our clients, and the Global Games Market Data, and our own platform and consumer insight dashboards.  Your Profile:  4-8 years relevant work experience with a market research or market intelligence agency; Experience leading client projects end to end including managing people, timelines, and deliverables. Direct experience managing client relationships through projects. Experience with quantitative research methodologies incl. survey programming, data analysis tools, and data processing using statistical packages and data management tools (SPSS and/or R); MSc degree (Market Research, Quantitative Psychology or Sociology, Marketing, Economics, Business Administration, or something similar); Passionate about games and/or esports and often plays games in their spare time is considered a plus; Ideally you are based in NL but working remote is also possible but then you would have to work for us as a freelancer in case of not being registered in The Netherlands.   Your Skills:  Strong analytical writing and communication skills in English (fluent); Strong analytical and statistical skills, can answer client questions independently with statistically sound advice based on the available data; Ability to think creatively and from a client perspective, look for insights from data that address the concerns and questions of the clients we work with; Confidence presenting and excellent interpersonal skills;  Interested?  Please apply by sending in your cv and motivation letter explaining why Newzoo, why this position, why gaming & esports industry and feel free to mention any quirks you might have!

Zaltbommel 32-40 uur  Bouw mee aan de Plieger Groep De Plieger Groep bestaat uit Plieger en ThermoNoord. We zijn gespecialiseerd in sanitair, verwarming, installatie, lucht & ventilatie en elektra. We bestaan meer dan 100 jaar en met 750 medewerkers bedienen wij dagelijks onze klanten in Nederland. We zijn onderdeel van de GC Gruppe, die marktleider is in Europa. We zijn financieel gezond: handig om te weten in deze onzekere tijden. Plieger is in een nieuwe fase waarbij we voortbouwen op de successen uit ons verleden, nieuwe kansen pakken én investeren in onze toekomst. Onder andere met de functie voor Data Marketeer. Bouw jij mee? Dit is je kans.  Waar bouw je aan mee? We willen als Plieger groeien op alle vlakken. Richting installateurs, met ons eigen product-merk Plieger en een steeds betere service richting consumenten. Op basis van concrete doelen ga je samen met je marketing-collega’s aan de slag met de praktische invulling om deze doelen te behalen. Je werkt vaak samen met de Online Marketeer, Marketing Lead en eCommerce collega’s: opzetten van marketing automation, e-mail campagnes, SEA-campagnes, etc. Jij zorgt ervoor dat dit allemaal data-driven gedaan wordt en voorziet je collega’s met inzichten en advies die jij uit de data naar boven weet te halen  . Jouw skill set Kleine lettertjes: we zoeken een duizendpoot en snappen dat je wellicht niet 100% van deze skills aan boord hebt, maar wel bereid bent deze te leren. Jij weet de juiste vragen te stellen aan Online Marketeers om onderzoeksvragen te formuleren en deze d.m.v data te beantwoorden. Je bent creatief in het vertalen van business vraagstukken naar data oplossingen en in staat om het in begrijpelijke taal uit te leggen aan je collega’s. Door jouw werk kunnen je collega’s aan de slag met data-driven mail campagnes, lead nurturing, marketing automation en performance marketing (SEA, Display, Socials). Behendig met Google Analytics (GA4) en in staat je collega’s van trainingen en ondersteuning te voorzien om hier de nodige informatie uit te halen. Je snapt Google Tag Management en weet hoe je componenten op de website meetbaar kan maken. Je bent bekend met Google Data Studio en in staat om dashboards op te zetten waarmee je de online marketeers en andere stakeholders van doorlopende inzichten voorziet. Je bent behendig met SQL en hebt ervaring met BigQuery om complexe data vraagstukken te beantwoorden. Je hebt ervaring met het opzetten van ETL/ELT pipelines in Google Cloud om data uit backend system op te halen en op te slaan in BigQuery. Je bent behendig in Python en kan goed overweg met deze taal om complexe analyses uit te voeren. Je hebt een passie voor data science en bent bekend met de verschillende machine learning technieken (supervised learning, unsupervised learning, recommender systems). Je hebt ervaring met Docker en het deployen van applicaties in de cloud, bij voorkeur Google Cloud. Pluspunten: Machine learning in Google Cloud, Tensorflow, Apache Airflow, Cloud functies, Docker, Kubernetes, SAP, EnterpriseOne, Adwords. We gebruiken de hele SAP-suite, maar zijn daar niet uitsluitend aan gebonden.  Jouw profiel Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in data driven marketing analyst, data science, data engineer, technical analytics engineer, aan bureau-kant of klant-kant. Kom je van bureau-kant: je kiest na je ride bij een bureau er bewust voor om te bouwen aan de Plieger Groep en haar digitale transitie. Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands. Engels is een natuurlijke 2e taal voor je. Positieve, actieve vibe. Yes is your favourite word! Pro-actief, zelfstarter, doorzetter, hands-on en oplossingsgericht (standaard vraag, maar geen standaard eigenschap). Je bent communicatief, brengt vernieuwing en kan collega’s meenemen en enthousiasmeren om gezamenlijke doelen te behalen. Je maakt duidelijke afspraken en managed verwachtingen van je collega’s, onze vaste freelancers en onze agencies Acorel, Dept en KesselsKramer. Je bent net zo gedreven als de rest van Plieger en ThermoNoord, en je durft te ondernemen.  Wij bieden Marktconform salaris. Veel ruimte voor initiatief, groei, vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Flexibele werktijden en werkplekken. Werk thuis en bijvoorbeeld op een van onze lokale vestigingen door het land. Groeiend en gezellig Marketing & eCommerce team. Macbook & iPhone. Aanstelling voor 32-40 uur. Bij fulltime dienstverband ook ADV-dagen met in totaal 37 vakantiedagen. Hoofd-locatie: Hoofdkantoor Zaltbommel, op loopafstand van het NS Station, centraal gelegen: binnen 30 minuten met de auto vanuit Utrecht en Den Bosch.  Veerle, één van je directe collega’s: https://www.linkedin.com/in/veerle-vos-5a298685/ Koen, eCommerce Lead https://www.linkedin.com/in/koenroelofs/ Jeroen, Marketing & eCommerce Manager https://www.linkedin.com/in/heydendael/ Koert, CEO https://www.linkedin.com/in/koert-huisman/

Ter uitbreiding van ons team zijn we op zoek naar een data / search analist. Je komt te werken bij de afdeling Marketing op onze vestiging in Rotterdam-Zuid. Deze afdeling bestaat momenteel uit een team van vier collega’s. Data heeft voor jou geen geheimen! Momenteel staat onze data in verschillende systemen, maar hier ga jij verandering in brengen. Jij gaat onder andere aan de slag met het ontwikkelen van verschillende analysemodellen en maakt analyses van zaken zoals klantwaarde, lead kwalificatie en customer lifetime value. Hiermee zorg jij voor relevante inzichten uit de beschikbare data. Je legt verbanden, trekt conclusies, informeert én adviseert de organisatie. Het betreft een zelfstandige functie binnen een team, waarbij jij de echte data specialist bent. Jij bent het aanspreekpunt voor je collega’s en neemt ze mee in jouw wereld. Het is daarbij natuurlijk belangrijk dat je dit leuk vindt om te doen, maar ook dat je communicatief vaardig genoeg bent om je collega’s uitleg te geven.  Wat vragen we van jou: HBO werk en denkniveau en minimaal 4 jaar ervaring in CRM en Analytics; Kennis van online marketing tools zoals SEA, SEO, SoME en affiliate-marketing; Kennis van CRM- en DMA-systemen (Salesforce, SAP en Adobe); Natuurlijk ben je analytisch sterk én goed in staat data te vertalen naar klantbehoefte. Je kunt goed zelfstandig werken en beheert het proces van verzamelen en analyseren tot het opstellen van een concrete strategie tot in de puntjes. Daarnaast ben je zowel commercieel als creatief ingesteld en vind je het leuk om je collega’s wegwijs te maken in de verschillende systemen. Geen vereisten, maar wel mooi meegenomen: Ervaring met Syntec, Autoline, PlanIT; Ervaring met Wordpress, Active Campaign; Ervaring binnen Automotive, zowel BtoC als BtoB.  Wat bieden wij: Wij bieden jou een zelfstandige functie als Data / Search Analist bij Auto Hoogenboom, onderdeel van Pon Holdings. Je werkt binnen een dynamische, op kwaliteit gerichte organisatie. Wij besteden veel aandacht aan de tevredenheid en gezondheid van onze medewerkers. Daarnaast bieden wij: Een marktconform salaris; Volop ontwikkel- en doorgroeimogelijkheden; 24 vakantiedagen; Een collectieve zorgverzekering met een werkgeversbijdrage van € 300 bruto per jaar; Deelname aan onze pensioenregeling; De mogelijkheid om mee te doen met de Pon Fit activiteiten zoals bootcamps, fiets- en wielertochten, hardloopevents, golfclinics, hockey en ga zo maar door!  Ben jij enthousiast en heb je het gevoel dat deze baan je op het lijf geschreven is? Reageer dan nu via onderstaande link en solliciteer direct! Voor inhoudelijke vragen kan je contact opnemen met Hubrecht Hauzer, Marketing manager via hubrecht.hauzer@autohoogenboom.nl. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Sales Operations Analyst First and foremost, we are riders. We share the core belief that bikes change lives. From product development and operations, to finance and marketing - every role at Specialized contributes to a culture of sustainable, global growth and innovation. We are always looking for passionate people to join the team who are interested in learning and growing far above the scope of the position. You’ll be challenged in many ways and have a tremendous amount of opportunity. All with an eye towards growing people and expanding careers. But we can’t do it without you. For our office in Arnhem, The Netherlands, Specialized is looking to hire a Sales Operations Analyst who is motivated, intellectually curious, analytical and strong communicator.  HOW YOU’LL MAKE A DIFFERENCE Create and control product inventory allocations to ensure the maximization of sales. Collaborate with Sales & Finance teams to execute on pricing strategies and sales programs. Manage and maintain pricing in the systems to ensure all pricelists are on point. Provide data, analyses, modeling, and reporting to support Sales & Demand Planning Teams. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand key business objectives and create analyses to track results Manage Sales & Marketing KPI metric dashboards on a monthly cadence. Develop and implement actionable plans to identify and resolve data discrepancies. WHAT YOU NEED TO WIN 2-4 years of working experience in Sales Operations or Finance field Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or related field In-depth, hands-on experience in aggregating, manipulating and visualizing data into actionable insights Advanced skills in Excel Outstanding presentation, reporting and communication skills Ability to work together with Sales, Marketing, Demand Planning, Finance and other functions in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical skills and business acumen Fluent in verbal and written English. Other European languages are an advantage. Familiar with Oracle, Tableau and Salesforce WHAT WE OFFER You will work with a great team of energetic colleagues in our new office in Arnhem. We offer 24 vacation days per year, on fulltime basis. We facilitate sportive “lunch rides” with colleagues whether in the woods or on the road. Better prefer to work out in our fitness room? We have it! Are you a racer? Join our companies’ Workforce road team. Are you a career tiger? We have great career opportunities with competitive salaries and secondary working conditions. Acquisition will not be appreciated.

Restaurant Company Europe (RCE) is een restaurantgroep met prachtige horecaconcepten zoals Loetje, Stan&Co, Beers & Barrels en Popo The Mexican en met mooie toekomstplannen in het vooruitzicht. Met meer dan 50 locaties en ruim 1700 medewerkers zijn wij de grootste restaurantgroep van Nederland. Bij RCE vragen we ons voortdurend af hoe we onze gasten nog beter kunnen bedienen. Door meer gebruik te gaan maken van data komen we nog dichter bij de wens van onze gasten te staan. Om die reden zijn wij voor de afdeling Formulemanagement op het kantoor in Amstelveen per direct op zoek naar een gepassioneerde: F&B Data Analist (40 uur p.w.) Wie zoeken wij? Een energieke, analytische en assertieve data analist voor onze afdeling formulemanagement. Je bent een datapurist in hart en nieren met een voorliefde voor alles wat met food en beverage te maken heeft. Jij gelooft dat slimme keuzes gemaakt worden aan de hand van slimme inzichten en wil als spin in het web fungeren binnen deze afdeling. Jij weet als geen ander hoe je moet sturen op basis van cijfers, houdt controle over interne processen en bent handig met Excel. Daarnaast weet je op heldere manier een vertaalslag te maken naar concrete actiepunten. Verder ben je een op-en-top horecaliefhebber en heb je interesse in alle facetten van bedrijfsvoering. Op basis van jouw analyses weet jij RCE naar het volgende level te krijgen. Met jouw bijdrage zullen we steeds beter in staat zijn de wens van onze gast in kaart te brengen. Wij leren graag van jouw expertise! Daarnaast zit adviseren in je bloed en ben je sterk in het geven van duidelijke presentaties. Wat ga je doen? Je wordt onze strategische partner op de afdeling formulemanagement. Als F&B Data analist bij RCE ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het organiseren, analyseren, interpreteren en vertalen van data binnen onze business units. Van het beheren van de verschillende receptuurbibliotheken tot strategische pricing, menu engineering en category analyses, jij draait er je hand niet voor om. Je ondersteunt hierbij de formulemanager, fooddeveloper en conceptdeveloper om op basis van data strategisch onderbouwde keuzes te maken. Tegelijkertijd zorg jij dat interne processen rondom wijzigingen in het assortiment soepel lopen door communicatie met andere afdelingen zoals ICT, inkoop en marketing. Op basis van de aanwezige data weet jij écht de vertaalslag te maken. Je advies is overstijgend aan de afdelingen. Jij ziet waar bepaalde zaken samenvallen en kan hier op creatieve en doordachte wijze een advies op formuleren. Daarnaast breng je op eigen initiatief, data gestuurd advies uit, om onze afdelingen voortdurend bij te sturen. Eigenwijsheid wordt hier zeker gewaardeerd! Krijg jij dus veel energie van organiseren en analyseren? En wil je onze afdeling formulemanagement én RCE adviseren bij het maken van slimme en onderbouwde keuzes. Dan ben je bij ons aan het juiste adres. Wat neem jij mee? Hbo/WO-opleiding. Bij voorkeur met kwantitatieve onderzoeksmethoden. 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare data of analytisch gedreven rol in bijvoorbeeld (F&B) controlling of category management. Uitstekend strategisch en analytisch inzicht. Kennis van of goede aanleg voor onder andere Power BI, Dax, Excel Ervaring met inkoopsystemen zoals Inone, Horeko, VIA, Apicbase is een pre Grote voorliefde voor de horeca en/of food-sector. Een goede dosis positiviteit en drang om met ons mee te bouwen aan het merk RCE. Wat je van ons kunt verwachten: Een marktconform salaris afhankelijk van werkervaring met prima secundaire voorwaarden. 25 vakantiedagen. Jouw ideale vervolgstap in de wereld van data & analytics. Een start op de afdeling formulemanagement, met mogelijk doorgroei naar een organisatiebrede rol. Een topwerksfeer met leuke en gemotiveerde collega’s. En nu? Lijkt dit je wat? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw cv én motivatie. Zodra wij jouw sollicitatie binnen hebben, ontvang je van ons een bevestiging. Jouw sollicitatie wordt vervolgens bij ons op het kantoor in behandeling genomen.  Opleidingsniveau: HBO/WO

DETAILS  Role: Equity research analyst - Junior Department: Institutional brokerage Duration: Permanent Start date: As soon as possible Location: Amsterdam KEPLER CHEUVREUX  Kepler Cheuvreux is a leading independent European financial services company. The group leverages its research expertise in the following business lines: equities, debt and derivatives, investment solutions and corporate finance. The equity research business provides thought provoking actionable sector and stock specific research to institutional investment professionals. The team consists over 100 professionals located in Paris, London, Stockholm, Frankfurt, Zurich, Milan, Brussels, Amsterdam, Oslo, Madrid and Vienna.  Kepler Cheuvreux / Key Figures: 1st independent European equity broker 1 billion euros of equities traded daily on average 1st Equity Research coverage in Continental Europe 2nd best broker for research in Europe (Extel 2019) 13 majors financial centres in Europe and the USA 600 employees 1,200 institutional clients YOUR TASKS  Kepler Cheuvreux Group is seeking for its office in Amsterdam a Junior Equity research analyst. The equity research analyst conveys Kepler Cheuvreux strategic view, recommends stocks.  During your employment, you will notably be in charge of: Research coverage of listed companies within the stock market; Fundamental analysis: In-depth industry and company modelling, and perform valuation analysis in order to derive investment recommendations; Write and publish financial research reports; Present the findings to institutional investors and Kepler Cheuvreux equity salesforce; Extensive marketing: analyst presentations, meetings with investors, ongoing service to buy-side counterparts, etc; Contribute and support the pan-European sector product. YOUR PROFILE & SKILLS  The candidate should meet the following requirements: Graduated in BA or Master’s degree; Proven analytical, computer (Microsoft office) and interpersonal skills such as exceptional writing and communication; It will involve working in a fast paced environment; It requires an individual who has strong interest and understanding of financial markets; Past experience within financial institutions or in a similar role (junior level- 0 to 3 years work experience); Dynamic and entrepreneurial; Team player who likes to work in an inspiring but demanding environment; You are fluent in Dutch and English. RECRUTMENT PROCESS: Between 2 and 3 rounds of interviews: both fit and technical questions  You will need a flexible and creative approach in order to flourish in our international environment and succeed with our diverse client base. If you possess these qualities and would like to be part of Kepler Cheuvreux’s story, then come and join us!  Henri BERTRAND, Group Head of Human Resources  Please note that Kepler Cheuvreux promotes equal opportunity. All applications will be given due consideration

The Business Intelligence analyst in our Strategy & Intelligence team is responsible for supporting the team’s efforts to improve the company's understanding of the market and competitive environment in which we operate. This includes maintaining our global intelligence platform, collecting and analyzing all kinds or data, connecting the outside-in and inside-out perspective and reporting the insights to our management and the business.  What we ask You have a broader view than just your position and you can identify with our purpose ‘Nourishing by Nature’. You are customer focused and are able to act with speed and decisiveness to achieve the best results. You take responsibility for your work and you continuously look for new opportunities to make a change. You are open minded, a team player, eager to learn, stress resistant, flexible and have good communication and strongly developed analytical skills. You preferably have a bachelor degree in Business Administration or comparable Knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint is a must-have, PowerBI is a pre. Knowledge of the dairy sector is a pre. You have at least 3 years of experience in a role of market analyst or intelligence analyst. What we offer Strategy & Intelligence is a small, but highly dynamic staff department, directly reporting to the President of FrieslandCampina Trading and is located in the Head Office in Amersfoort.Strategy & Intelligence plays an important role with respect to various topics, such as: Strategic analyses as input for decision making on the long-term strategy of FrieslandCampina’s Trading division Identification of opportunities and threats in the competitive environment Counseling other departments on pricing and tactical and operational moves Business support with data, analyses and methodic advise Connecting the outside-in with the inside-out perspectiveYour salary is based on the weighing of your job and your experience. FrieslandCampina does not however only compensate its employees with monetary rewards. We also consider it important for our people to continue to grow. After all, your development is not only good for your career; our company also benefits from it. That is why we invest in relevant training courses in your particular discipline. The mutual exchange of knowledge between colleagues is also evident on the work floor. It is, after all, the most effective way to learn. Vacancy description The Business Intelligence Analyst in our Strategy & Intelligence team has a wide range of responsibilities, including: Facilitation of intelligence for strategic, tactical and operational decision making:oExploiting and developing the global intelligence portal / databaseoIdentifying information needs in the business and potential data suppliersoActively contributing to structural improvements in the availability and use of data and analyses for fact-based decision making Providing intelligence analyses for strategic decision making:oStructurally collecting information that leads to a better understanding of the changes in the market and the competitive environmentoCarrying out and reporting ad-hoc and / or project-based analyses for strategic and / or tactical decision-makingoAdvising (top) management, marketing and sales in strategic, tactical and / or operational issues regarding competition and market developments Advise BG and OpCo MTs on relevant commercial topics:oContribute in process optimization, to advice on insights that are important forocommercial decision makingoAdvice OpCo on potential risks and risk mitigating actions Stakeholder and relation management in and outside the business:oBuild relationships across various business units to identify opportunities to create additional value for FC Trading and FC at largeoBuild relationships outside the business to bring outside information into the business in order to enrich our view on the marketoParticipate in and initiate relevant strategic and business growth initiativesoKeep close contact with BI community to build and expand the joint knowledge of the business environment

About AbbVie AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.  Are you an ambitious finance professional, thriving as a self-starter and true sparring partner to the business in an international matrix environment? Join our Allergan Aesthetics Finance team as a FP&A Senior Analyst! As FP&A Senior Analyst you will be supporting the Netherlands and Belgium Allergan Aesthetics entities, which crosses several departments for our Commercial business. You will be responsible for accurate reporting & analysis of the results of the business performance against historical, budgeted, forecasted and strategic planning results to facilitate decision-making toward the achievement of the budget and strategic plan. You will act as a business partner to the Allergan Aesthetics Commercial Leadership Team, work closely with our Europe region and Western Europe Canada FP&A functions and on projects as needed. This role offers a broad variety on tasks enabling you to unleash your full potential! This role is a great steppingstone to broader responsibilities over time. You will be based in Hoofddorp, Netherlands. Reporting to the Associate Director Finance. Your responsibilities Budgeting, Forecasting and Long-Range P&Ls Prepare, analyse, consolidate for the country / cluster as applicable, evaluate and submit the Budget, Forecast and Long-Range Plan P&Ls; Management of the forecast and budget submissions for submission to Europe Region   Business Partner with Commercial Management team Provide insightful analysis of current business trends and financial metrics along with recommendations for improvement or risk mitigation for consideration by the Key Stake holders in Allergan Aesthetics Commercial Leadership Team; Management of promotional and other variable budgets with the Commercial Leadership teams; Analysing sales trends and providing insight and support Work closely with the Europe Region Finance Team to ensure process alignment, best practice sharing and knowledge transfer, e.g. around systems. Complete Reporting for month / quarter / year end close Preparation and/or review of expenses and sales journals; Partner with the business to ensure accurate and appropriate recording expenses; Responsible for driving efficiencies in regular reporting through standardisation and automation where appropriate. Analysis and Periodic Reporting of expenses to Country, Cluster and Europe Region; Development of expense trackers for the marketing teams for managing quarterly spend and achievement vs Budget; Ad Hoc / project work as required, for example Commercial analysis related, eg partnering with Business Excellence to ensure commercial reporting is developed to serve the needs of a variety of stakeholders and adds real value Controls related, eg supporting the definition, implementation, documentation, assessment and monitoring of key controls, ensuring adherence to Abbvie standards and policies Operating Model Integration related  Qualifications  Your qualifications Degree education in relevant discipline Qualified Chartered Accountant or CIMA preferred Prior experience in a FP&A role supporting a Global/ International commercial organisation in the Pharmaceutical / Medical/ FMCG industry will be advantageous. In-depth understanding of financial statements (balance sheet, P&L and cash flow) & core finance/accounting concepts Ability to balance broad strategic objectives with the ability to execute day-to-day tactical operations Ability to recognize key issues and effectively communicate those to management Strong interpersonal and presentation skills and ability to build a strong network across the organization Good interpersonal skills, including the ability and desire to communicate, collaborate, and coordinate with others throughout the business and finance organizations Strong business acumen and customer focus Strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills. Strong spreadsheet, power point, and financial systems experience Knowledge of financial systems (SAP)  Travel Yes, 15 % of the Time Job Type Experienced Schedule Full-time Job Level Code IC Equal Employment Opportunity At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients. As an equal opportunity employer we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Ben jij analytisch sterk, graag bezig met data, heeft SQL geen geheimen voor jou en ben je daarnaast ook nog nieuwsgierig van aard? Wil je graag bij een jong en dynamisch data-gedreven organisatie werken? Lees dan verder en solliciteer op deze vacature.   Als Data Analist / Business Intelligence Analist bij My Jewellery werk jij dagelijks aan het verwerken en analyseren van data. Aan jou de taak om de complexe datawarehouse omgeving continu te optimaliseren. In jouw rol als Data Analist/BI Analist denk je na over hoe je de data in het datamodel het beste kan organiseren. Je legt d.m.v. SQL verbanden tussen data uit verschillende bronnen, analyseert en controleert de data. Daarnaast zorg je ervoor dat de business d.m.v. dashboards dagelijks de resultaten kan gebruiken om data-gedreven beslissingen te nemen.  Jouw analyses en oplossingen helpen anderen binnen My Jewellery beter te presteren en bieden strategische inzichten om de juiste keuzes te maken. De gegevens die je verwerkt komen onder andere uit onze e-commerce-, ERP en marketing automationsystemen, maar ook van externe bronnen zoals social media kanalen. Binnen My Jewellery ben je één van de eerste aanspreekpunten voor vragen over data en dashboards. Dit ga je natuurlijk niet alleen doen, je komt te werken binnen het BI team van My Jewellery. Een jong en gedreven team waar innovatie voorop staat dat bestaat, uit Data Engineers, Data Analisten en Data Scientists.  Je komt te werken in een jonge en snelgroeiende organisatie waar heel veel behoefte is aan data en inzichten. Voorbeelden van analyses en dashboards zijn verkoop-analyses op product en klant niveau, voorraad-analyses, social media performance dashboards, management dashboards, etc. Op basis van jouw inzichten en analyses geef je gevraagd en ongevraagd advies over kansen.  Taken Je vervult de functie van Data Analist binnen de afdeling Business Intelligence & Development. Onder de functie vallen onder andere de volgende taken: Je controleert data op juistheid en analyseert deze om vervolgens inzichten te kunnen bieden; Je stelt dashboards op en ziet toe op het juiste gebruik hiervan; Op basis van je analyses breng je advies uit aan de relevante stakeholders; Naast dat je vragen uit de business analyseert, initieer je ook je eigen data-analyses om de organisatie verder te brengen; Je helpt mee aan de ontwikkeling, onderhoud en toepassing van datamodellen en dashboards. Functievereisten Je hebt afgeronde relevante HBO- of WO-opleiding (e.g. Economie, Bedrijfskunde, Wiskunde, Informatica, etc.); 2+ jaar relevante werkervaring in een data gerelateerde functie; Je bent zelfstandig, nieuwsgierig en analytisch; Je hebt een wiskundig en statistisch inzicht; Je hebt kennis van databases, datawarehouse architectuur, ETL-processen en datamodellen; Ervaring met SQL en het maken van dashboards is een harde eis; Kennis van Python, Google Big Query en Google Data Studio zijn een pré.   Wij bieden Een uitdagende full time functie met veel zelfstandigheid en genoeg ruimte voor eigen ideeën en input. Werken bij een zeer snelgroeiend E-commerce en Retail bedrijf. Een marktconform salaris met goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals pensioenregeling, reiskostenvergoeding, sporten met je collega’s, héle leuke personeelskorting op ons hele assortiment en leuke events.  Solliciteer! Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Stuur dan een mail met jouw vraag naar Leonieke via leonieke.vroom@my-jewellery.com

Full-time · Amsterdam Hi, we are Mollie! Our mission is creating a greater playing field for everyone. By offering convenient, safe and worldwide payment solutions we remove barriers for companies of all sizes to compete on equal terms.  Your opportunity: We’re accelerating our international expansion on the back of our recent €90m series B funding round. This is an exceptional opportunity for an ambitious performance marketer to supercharge customer acquisition growth by managing and growing a 7+ figure marketing budget. You will make sure that our core mix of online channels (PPC, Facebook and LinkedIn) hit and exceed customer acquisition targets through implementing effective strategies, in line with best practice, and an ambitious program of experimentation and measurement. Longer term, we also aim to introduce more channels (like YouTube) and do more with the upper funnel through display advertising. You’ll work with agencies who do the ‘heavy lifting’ of media buying & optimisation to hit your target, bring in specialist freelancers to hit your stretch targets and brief creative concepts to our internal design team or creative agencies. You will be reporting to our Head of Performance Marketing, work closely with key people in-market (e.g. in our German and Dutch teams) and coordinate with our SEO Lead, Head of Conversions, Content Lead and Performance Marketing Analyst. What you'll be doing: Take primary responsibility for core paid marketing channels: our new customer volumes / their CPAs / their quality (as proxied by customer lifetime value)  Create testing plans, report and act weekly to improve performance of our proven channels toward a return on investment of our marketing spend  Brief creative concepts to our internal design team or creative agencies  Analyse and forecast performance to set targets and budgets  Work closely with key stakeholders in-market, our SEO Lead, Head of Conversions, Content Lead and Performance Marketing Analyst. Manage and help get the best out of the agency partners we work with  Meet some of the team Pieter  Head of Performance Marketing  Katharina  VP of DACH  Joseph  Head of Conversion  Marina  Marketing Manager

Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Are you dreaming about being the next Erika Hall, Elizabeth Churchill or Jan Chipchase? Are you passionate about identifying and articulating user motivations, wants, needs, and pain points, using appropriate and creative research methods? Do you thrive in sharing these insights in a collaborative environment, with design, data, development, and customer teams? Are you enthusiastic about translating insights into action and ultimately, user-friendly products? Do you have a proven track record in a research function in a software development context? We are looking for a senior user experience researcher to join our growing research team.  About AppDev Your work will enable Mendix to take the developer experience of our products to the next level. Your work will be focussed on the initiatives within the AppDev unit, the biggest R&D unit, which is at the heart of our products (with Mendix Studio & Studio Pro, the core tools for Mendix developers). This Unit's ultimate goal is to make Mendix Studio and Studio Pro the most-loved low-code Integrated Development Environments in the world. In this Unit, you will work with designers and product managers in the Frontend teams, the Logic teams, the Mendix Assist team, and the Studio and the Studio Pro Core teams.  About the Design team The Design team is a distributed discipline across several units in Boston, Pune, Shanghai and Rotterdam, with many disciplines. From user experience research and service design to brand and product design, the Mendix design team is filled with creatives focused on elevating the user experience across our products. The team is always exploring new ways to be creative and tinkering with new technologies or techniques. We believe that cross-unit and cross-disciplinary collaboration is the key to our success.  About the User Experience Research team: User Experience Research is a growing subdiscipline, part of the Product Design Team (in the R&D department). In the past two years we have grown from no researchers, to currently 9 research specialists, now also including a Research Operations Specialist. The User Experience Researchers work with one of the R&D units (in this case the AppDev unit), or from the central research team. To discuss anything relevant to User Experience Researchers, we have a bi-weekly team meeting. The User Experience Research Team is also driving the User Insights Guild, where we meet with Product Analysts, Service Designers, and anyone else interested in our work and insights. Our research toolset contains SurveyMonkey, Lookback and Dovetail, but of course we also use tools like Zoom, Miro and Dropbox Paper when planning and conducting our research.  Responsibilities As a Senior User Experience Researcher with the AppDev unit, you explore drivers and barriers contributing to the user experience of Mendix developers, and enable user centric and strategic design decisions.  This means you: Investigate and prioritize relevant research topics for the AppDev unit. Based on company and unit level priorities, ongoing alignment with product managers, product designers and service designers, and your own proactive suggestions, you create and own the research roadmap for the AppDev unit. Define, scope, plan, and conduct user experience research. Based on research priorities, you define the scope and research questions, select the appropriate method(s), and create a plan for your research. You align on participant recruitment criteria with your stakeholders and the Research Operations Specialist. When conducting research, you always try to include others: you invite stakeholders to observe fieldwork, or empower others to do research. Synthesise and share compelling insights that inform both product strategy and product design decisions. You are comfortable making trade offs between diving deep into your data, or delivering quick insights. You communicate your research results to your direct stakeholders in the AppDev unit, but always try to keep a wider audience in mind. You effectively use different channels (e.g. Slack, our User Insight Guild) to create awareness for your research and insights. Contribute to maturing, expanding and improving our research practice. Research is a new discipline at Mendix, and within the Product Design team. This means that our research team is constantly making an effort to becoming more mature and improving our impact. Examples vary from small and practical (creating templates for research plans, interview guides, etc.) to more fundamental (creating a universal tagging structure, to be used across projects). Foster collaboration with other disciplines. We truly believe that collaborating cross-disciplines is essential in making an impact. Therefore we expect you to (proactively) foster collaboration with other disciplines: collaboration with product analysts to creating solid insights, collaboration inside and outside R&D in order to tap in to other data sources, but also build strong relationships with product designers, service designers, product managers and the engineering teams in AppDev Requirements 5+ years in a user experience research role at a software-focused company or equivalent experience Broad experience in generating insights from cutting edge quantitative and qualitative research methods, and using techniques like context mapping Demonstrated experience researching applications designed to serve multiple user profiles who operate in complex environments A proven track record of shipped products driven by research insights Degree in HCI, Psychology, Anthropology, Social Science, or a related field Our recruitment process for this position consists of the following steps: You apply by means of a CV, cover letter, and sharing a challenging research project and how you approached this One of our recruiters will give you a call. In this call they can tell you more about Mendix and our company culture, and check if you would fit with the culture. This is followed by an interview with the design and research management. The final step is a portfolio presentation: you get to present yourself and your work to the team and unit you will be working wit. Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

Als Online Marketeer Video & Audio ben je verantwoordelijk voor het zo optimaal mogelijk inzetten van video & audio advertenties op o.a. YouTube en Spotify, waarbij je rekening houdt met de verschillende doelstellingen binnen Marketing en beslissingen onderbouwt met data. Wat doe je als Online Marketeer Video & Audio bij Coolblue?  Lijkt het je leuk om op basis van data zo goed mogelijke resultaten te behalen met advertenties op o.a. YouTube en Spotify? Lees dan vooral verder! Victorie legt je uit hoe je Online Marketeer Video & Audio bij Coolblue kunt worden.  Dit vind je leuk om te doen Online marketing is echt jouw passie en je vindt het leuk om met data onderbouwde marketingstrategieën te bedenken voor verschillende KPI's. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de resultaten van jouw campagnes, dus je gaat pro-actief op zoek naar verbeteringen en nieuwe ontwikkelingen binnen jouw marketingkanalen. Je presenteert wekelijks en maandelijks je resultaten richting je team en je manager. Je zet A/B testen op om de formule voor de beste campagne te vinden. Samen met de business analist zorg je ervoor dat alle data en inzichten beschikbaar zijn om de beste beslissingen te kunnen maken. Je krijgt energie van het werken met veel stakeholders, want in deze rol moet je veel schakelen met video- en audio productieteams, team Merk, team Marketingplannen, maar bijvoorbeeld ook met onze Google account managers. Je blijft op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen Google Ads en Display & Video 360, zodat deze platforms geen geheimen voor jou kennen. Ondanks dat je zelf geen content maakt, weet je wel de juiste briefings aan onze creatieve teams te geven om de beste advertenties voor je campagnes te verkrijgen.   Hier herken jij jezelf in Een afgeronde wo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in één van de richtingen: marketing, bedrijfskunde, economie, informatiemanagement. Goed met cijfers. Je weet data te vertalen naar concrete inzichten en actiepunten. Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift. Ervaring met Google Ads en/of Display & Video 360 is een pré. In een grote organisatie met veel stakeholders voel jij je als een vis in het water. Nieuwsgierig, zelfstartend en een sterk analytisch vermogen. Pro-actief kansen signaleren en verantwoordelijkheid pakken om hiermee aan de slag te gaan.   Dit zoek jij verder in een baan Geld. Meer dan 30 trainingen in onze eigen Studiefabriek. Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen. 25 vakantiedagen. Als je belooft dat je terugkomt. Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling. Een kantoor waar je foto's van wilt maken op een toplocatie. Vanaf Rotterdam Centraal is het 3 keer vallen voor je er bent. Oké, het is 2 minuten lopen. Ongekend goede werksfeer. Met legendarische Coolblue-feesten, de leukste teamactiviteiten en een informele, speelse afdeling. Ruimte voor nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën. Daar staan we altijd voor open. Of je nu een week, maand of een jaar bij ons werkt. Uitdagend werk om helemaal in op te gaan, zodat je af en toe vergeet dat je aan het werk bent. Een platte organisatie in de breedste zin van het woord. Zo kun je gewoon een biertje drinken met de baas. Op dit moment werken we thuis wanneer dit mogelijk is. Natuurlijk zorgen we dat je thuis een top werkplek hebt. Inclusief bureaustoel, laptop en blauwe slingers.

At Britvic we are proud to make, market, and sell soft drinks that help millions of people around the world to enjoy life’s everyday moments. Britvic is a UK based soft drinks company with global presence. Britvic Teisseire International, where this role resides, is responsible for the BeNeFraLux home market and the global expansion of Britvic owned brands including Teisseire, Mathieu Teisseire, London Essence, and Britvic Mixers. Britvic Teisseire International will be a critical driver of growth for Britvic to achieve its ambition of joining the FTSE 100 index on the London Stock Exchange. As Britvic Teisseire International continues to grow we are now looking for a Graduate Insights Analyst to support the Insights Manager and provide the business with accurate information on the performance of brands in the market. This role will be based in Amsterdam with occasional international travel required. Key responsibilities of a Graduate Insights Analyst: Define and maintain reporting setup: topline-reporting, in-depth reporting, self-service reporting Retail performance reporting (Nielsen) – setup reports, provide updates, analyse performance and pro-actively recommend on actions Promotional analysis with the RGM-manager Support the trade marketing managers / commercial team on category analysis Total market / On-trade reporting: ensure up to date reporting on “total market” performance is in place (Global Data; other sources when relevant). Ensure easy to access information for the teams Ex-factory performance reporting: ensure there is one database from which all details can be accessed: market, brand, package, and SKU-level. Perform in-depth analysis based on insight needs (e.g. category/brand/market deep dive). If necessary, commission research externally (e.g. Nielsen/Global Data)  Knowledge & Skills required: Proven, strong analytical skills. Experience and/or affinity with ad-hoc and continuous research Experience with Nielsen/IRI databases and reporting. Excel expert. DATE September, 2020 SUBJECT Vacancy Junior Consultant Health The Decision Group Are you interested in the field of health and life sciences and looking for a challenging job within a fast-learning organization? The position of business analyst at The Decision Group might be the perfect job for you! Join the pioneering strategy consulting firm The Decision Group: a company with a strong focus on health care & life sciences. Deliver and help clients to focus on creating value by using the most cutting-edge knowledge in the field of health and life sciences in our day-to- day practice of consulting, doing research, and making executive education programs. Business Analyst Health We are looking for a full-time colleague who (minimally) has a master’s degree on a university level and affinity with health and life sciences. You will team up with a consultant managing multiple projects, from account management and client relations to educational projects which involves taking a deep-dive into various healthcare. Together you will work on all aspects of a project, ranging from client contact to marketing to small administrative tasks. We are looking for someone with 1. Fluency in both Dutch and English; 2. A master’s degree in the field of health & life sciences; 3. Interest/affinity and preferably experience in: a. Value-Based Health Care and Value-Based Health Care implementation projects and education with a digital focus (a.o. e-health, data, AI) b. Digital transformation and services/products (internally and for clients); c. Business (a highly developed sense of commercialism and experience in marketing/communication); d. (Project) Management (planning skills, able to prioritize and work within deadlines, keeping an overview in hectic surroundings); e. Client relations and adding value for them; f. Willingness to work internationally; g. Consulting and change management experience or proven interest; 4. The following competencies: a. Positive and enthusiastic; b. Thorough; c. Hands-on mentality; d. Entrepreneurial and independent; 5. Excellent skills in MS Office.  What we offer 1. Fast-learning by doing; 2. Informal but professional and challenging surroundings; 3. Critical feedback loops to get the most out of you; 4. Working closely together in a team with great colleagues; 5. Freedom and responsibility; ‘head-first’, initiative and creativity; 6. All can build the company, you are important! How to apply Interested? Please send your application, together with your CV and a recent list of grades to info@thedecisiongroup.nl or call +31 (0)20 4040 111 for more information.

The Role Shell Energy Europe and Environmental Products (SE-EE) trades natural gas, power and environmental products with thousands of counter-parties including major resource holders of gas, upstream producers, investment banks, trading houses, utilities, power generators, large as well as up-and-coming retail gas and power marketing companies, regional and local gas and power distribution companies, gas storage operators, and large industrial and commercial gas and power users. What’s the role? You will be part of the Sales team and as Pricing Analyst, you will be focusing on the Dutch Gas and Power I&C Sales business of Shell Energy Europe (SEE), both on deal by deal basis as well as overall portfolio. More specifically, your responsibilities will include: Valuing structured natural gas and power transactions (potentially combined with environmental products); Supporting the development and maintenance of automated pricing tools; Defining the pricing structure to customers, evaluating both the costs (flexibility, working capital, cost to serve) and the potential value sources (cross-selling, extrinsic, fit to the portfolio); Identifying and quantifying the market realities, embedded optionality, and risks inherent in the transactions initiated by the commercial organization; Working with commercial project leaders to structure optimal deals, while challenging assumptions and suggesting alternative solutions. Preparing and presenting summaries of above analyses; Moderating deal discussions between Trading (London) and Sales to find alignment especially on pricing, structure, risk mitigation and operational handling; Monitoring and understanding Exposures; Helping improve forecasting tools; Sharing knowledge in local commodities and structures with other Structured analysts and cover other markets during absence; Access the impact of a new transaction on the portfolio, and be part of the portfolio management team. What do we need from you? We’re keen to hear from professionals who have a numerical degree. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV: Solid experience in pricing and portfolio management preferably gained from the Dutch Energy market (Trading experience is a plus); Has commercial acumen with strong quantitative, analytical, research, and problem-solving skills with extreme attention to detail; Has advanced Microsoft Office Excel skills with the ability to mentally manage a large amount of market information; Proven ability to model, run, and analyze statistical and financial data; Has the ability to work under minimal supervision within a complex, regional team; Excellent reporting, presentation, and verbal and written communication skills (in both Dutch and English a clear plus); COMPANY DESCRIPTION Shell Nederland BV is a platform for international collaboration, with Shell offering direct employment to around ten thousand people in the Netherlands alone, including roughly 2,800 non-Dutch employees from around 80 countries. Diversity is key at Shell Nederland, and our employees reflect the innovation that stems from a diverse workforce. By joining Shell Nederland, you will benefit from an unrivalled industry-leading development programme that will see you tap into a pool of expert knowledge that will help propel your career. Shell Nederland is the holding company of most Shell companies operating in the Netherlands. Shell Nederland also has an advisory and coordinating role in numerous areas. An innovative place to work There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change. Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently. An inclusive place to work To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential… We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there. We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology. We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application. A rewarding place to work Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice. We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.  Disclaimer Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Amsterdam –Automotive Mediaventions is een joint venture tussen DPG Media en Mediahuis. Ter uitbreiding van het team zijn we op zoek naar een web analist!  Wat ga je doen Als web analist bij Automotive Mediaventions ben je continu bezig met het analyseren van het verkeer op de websites van de drie merken Gaspedaal, AutoTrack en Autowereld. Hiervoor heb je diverse tools tot je beschikking zoals Google Analytics, Snowplow, Supermetrics, Usabilla etc. Door data te koppelen, analyseren en vertalen ben jij goed in staat de business te adviseren en direct sturing op lopende processen en campagnes te geven. Het is dan ook van belang dat je een echte teamplayer bent en op zowel operationeel als strategisch niveau kunt meedraaien. Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor: De tag management omgeving (GTM) van de drie verschillende websites. Het consistent configureren en onderhouden van Google Analytics 360. Je houd je bezig met data analyse kijkende naar het pricingbeleid. Het opstellen van meetplannen voor nieuwe functionaliteiten. Het inrichten en onderhouden van dashboards en rapportages. Het adviseren van de business bij het interpreteren van de cijfers in dashboards zoals: Het adviseren over de inzet van uiteenlopende marketing platformen bij online en omnichannel campagnes. Voorstellen voor verbetering van conversie (van marketingkanalen en de website). Het begeleiden van A/B en multivariable testen; van het opstellen van de test hypothese tot de het in productie nemen van testresultaat.  Wie zijn wij Je komt in een zeer hecht team terecht waar veel gelachen wordt en minstens zo hard gewerkt. Niet lullen maar poetsen is het credo en iedereen ervaart veel vrijheid om zijn/haar eigen dagen in te delen. Met deze vrijheid komt een grote mate van zelfstandigheid en die moet je aankunnen. Het marketing team bestaat uit 9 zeer gedreven collega’s die allen hun eigen specialisme hebben en die gezamenlijk optrekken om er met elkaar een succes van te maken.  Als hét grootste mediabedrijf van Nederland staat we open voor alle talent in de maatschappij. Wij roepen kandidaten met een diverse achtergrond in de breedste zin van het woord dan ook op om te solliciteren op deze functie. Juist door de verschillen tussen collega’s ontstaan verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En dat past dan weer heel erg goed bij ons als organisatie. We zijn benieuwd wie jij bent en welke kwaliteiten en ervaring jij meebrengt. Over Automotive Mediaventions Met sterke merken als Gaspedaal, AutoTrack en Autowereld zijn wij dé partner voor bedrijven binnen de Nederlandse automotive markt en bereiken we maandelijks 6 miljoen bezoekers. De sites zijn complementair aan elkaar en bedienen grotendeels verschillende typen consumenten en zakelijke klanten. Waar Gaspedaal het beschikbare auto-aanbod in Nederland vertoont, biedt AutoTrack extra checks, informatie en zekerheden rondom de aangeboden auto’s en is Autowereld het freemium alternatief voor de zakelijke adverteerder. Daarnaast biedt Automotive Mediaventions B.V. als joint venture van DPG Media en Mediahuis een gecombineerde bereik van beide mediahuizen. Met o.a. AD, Telegraaf, Volkskrant, Nu.nl en Q-music zijn de twee merken zichtbaar naar de Nederlandse autokoper, en profiteren de adverteerders van zowel een landelijk als regionaal bereik voor hun advertenties.  Wij bieden jou Salaris, passend bij jouw ervaring. Je ontvangt 8% vakantiegeld en 4% persoonlijk budget. 36-urige werkweek. Volop opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Een leuk en dynamisch team waar je veel mee gaat samenwerken.  Functie eisen Je hebt minimaal vier jaar werkervaring als web analist. Je bent analytisch, nauwkeurig en nieuwsgierig van aard. Je hebt alle levels van Google Analytics uitgespeeld en kunt goed analyses maken in diverse analytics en marketing tools. Je kunt businessvragen en -doelstellingen vertalen naar een dashboard omgeving. Je hebt ervaring met A/B en multivariate testing en kan overweg met tools als Google Optimize. Het is een pré als je ervaring hebt met Javascript, SQL of andere talen. Je vindt het leuk om je (verder) te ontwikkelen in complexere data vraagstukken.  Word jij onze nieuwe collega? Solliciteer dan nu! Heb jij eerst nog vragen? Ik beantwoord die graag via roxanne.rinkes@dpgmedia.nl of 06-21370122. Een WhatsApp bericht mag ook.  Wij doen graag onze werving zelf en wensen niet samen te werken met externe partijen voor de invulling van deze rol.

Are you an experienced marketing leader who is passionate about communications? This opportunity will not only lead all communications efforts at Foleon, but will also be instrumental in driving our growth as a thought leader through awareness efforts and use of Foleon - what we like to call "drinking our own champagne"  Your Mission As the Global Head of Brand & Comms, you will set the strategy for building Foleon brand awareness by establishing "brand to demand" through creative awareness campaigns, thought leadership, media/analyst relations, industry/partner (digital) events and social media. Reporting to the SVP of Global Marketing, you will own our overall communications & brand strategy, working closely with creative services, content marketing, leadership team and other marketing functions. Your goal is to create a brand that disrupts the content creation & content marketing space through our vision of "content democratization". You will drive deep engagement with higher level decision makers (CMO, VP) in our target audience, especially in the US.  Your Focus Develop a communications strategy & guidelines that deliver on our mission and brand promise, ensuring that our communications & brand are consistent and relevant across all channels Develop, execute and measure awareness & thought leadership campaigns Create an outreach program - media, analysts, tech ecosystem - to build awareness in channels where our audience is already engaged. Act as the brand ambassador by ensuring that our brand guidelines are kept up to date and that they are adhered to in all communications Own our social media presence and ensure alignment with paid social activities (i.e. demand generation campaigns) Create thought leadership content directly and/or through 3rd parties (research, contributed article, partner, customer) Work closely with the Head of Content Marketing on brand guidelines, content strategy, web communications and content delivery Align with marketing team to support communications as needed on integrated campaigns, customer marketing, product marketing and ad copy   Your Competences & Skills Excellent written and verbal communications Strategic and creative thinker who knows how to inspire your target audience Self motivated with the ability to work independently or within (remote) teams Excellent project management skills  Your Qualifications 7+ years experience Fluency in written and spoken English required Excellent writing skills - including ad copywriting and long form Proven experience in establishing a brand Strong media relationships & knowledge of martech media landscape Prior experience in B2B software, preferably in the Martech space Proven ability to manage multiple projects in a fast paced environment B2C branding background is a plus  Interested and would you like to learn more about this opening and us? Please go to http://jobs.foleon.com/director-of-brand-communications/ ti see the Foleon version of this vacancy!

About the Role As part of our EMEA CRM team, you will play a key role by leading our CRM strategies and executions. You will manage CRM campaigns as well as run A/B tests to learn and develop best practices. You'll collaborate and work closely both within EMEA as well as globally with various teams and business stakeholders from deployment specialists, operations managers, analysts, marketers to product managers and creatives to deliver the right message to the right audience at the right time. What You'll Do Coordinate all CRM campaigns for Uber's Delivery and Mobility business in EMEA. Be the CRM channel specialist in the region. Partner with relevant business counterparts in developing the regional CRM strategy. Lead and develop the CRM calendar Work closely with regional business partners to ensure regular planning and prioritization of CRM campaigns within the region. Plan, execute and measure key regional CRM campaigns. This includes CRM channel strategy, targeting, and reporting. Run coordinated experimentation and A/B testing that will generate the insights of tomorrow. Communicate and coordinate with partners regarding campaign status updates, launch confirmations, ETAs, blockers, etc. Develop, detail, and socialize CRM standard methodologies. Basic Qualifications At least 5 years experience in Marketing, E-Commerce, or highly analytical roles. Consistent track record of developing strong CRM campaigns. Critical problem solver with creative solutions to tackle challenges and meet business requirements. Strong project management and interpersonal skills that enable you to work with cross-functional partners in different time zones, countries, and regions. Confidence to develop processes that drive operational efficiency at a global scale. Comfortable to analyze engagement data and develop conclusions based on insights. Strong passion to acquire new skills and taking the initiative to succeed. Preferred Qualifications BA or MA in Marketing or equivalent experience. Experience with Email Service Providers (e.g. Exact Target) is vital. Experience with Excel & SQL is a plus. At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.
