Sales Operations Analyst First and foremost, we are riders. We share the core belief that bikes change lives. From product development and operations, to finance and marketing - every role at Specialized contributes to a culture of sustainable, global growth and innovation. We are always looking for passionate people to join the team who are interested in learning and growing far above the scope of the position. You’ll be challenged in many ways and have a tremendous amount of opportunity. All with an eye towards growing people and expanding careers. But we can’t do it without you. For our office in Arnhem, The Netherlands, Specialized is looking to hire a Sales Operations Analyst who is motivated, intellectually curious, analytical and strong communicator.  HOW YOU’LL MAKE A DIFFERENCE Create and control product inventory allocations to ensure the maximization of sales. Collaborate with Sales & Finance teams to execute on pricing strategies and sales programs. Manage and maintain pricing in the systems to ensure all pricelists are on point. Provide data, analyses, modeling, and reporting to support Sales & Demand Planning Teams. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand key business objectives and create analyses to track results Manage Sales & Marketing KPI metric dashboards on a monthly cadence. Develop and implement actionable plans to identify and resolve data discrepancies. WHAT YOU NEED TO WIN 2-4 years of working experience in Sales Operations or Finance field Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or related field In-depth, hands-on experience in aggregating, manipulating and visualizing data into actionable insights Advanced skills in Excel Outstanding presentation, reporting and communication skills Ability to work together with Sales, Marketing, Demand Planning, Finance and other functions in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical skills and business acumen Fluent in verbal and written English. Other European languages are an advantage. Familiar with Oracle, Tableau and Salesforce WHAT WE OFFER You will work with a great team of energetic colleagues in our new office in Arnhem. We offer 24 vacation days per year, on fulltime basis. We facilitate sportive “lunch rides” with colleagues whether in the woods or on the road. Better prefer to work out in our fitness room? We have it! Are you a racer? Join our companies’ Workforce road team. Are you a career tiger? We have great career opportunities with competitive salaries and secondary working conditions. Acquisition will not be appreciated.

Over onze klant Walraven Sax is een marketing-en verkooporganisatie met een breed pakket wijnen en gedistilleerde dranken. De organisatie bestaat al sinds 1823 en is daarmee één van de oudste wijn en gedistilleerd distributeurs in de Nederlandse markt. De organisatie heeft haar kantoor in Breda. Tegenwoordig is Walraven Sax onderdeel van een internationale groep: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei GmbH. Walraven Sax bouwt in Nederland aan de gerenommeerde third party brands, zoals o.a. Torres, Barefoot, Louis Roederer, Marqués de Riscal en Amarula, maar ook aan enkele eigen merken. Naast de A-merken, eigen merken, productiefaciliteiten en een exportorganisatie heeft onze groep distributie organisaties in Nederland, België, Duitsland, Oostenrijk, Zwitserland en de USA. Taken en verantwoordelijkheden In de functie van Supply Chain Analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor optimalisatie van de supply chain. Hierbij ben je voortdurend aan het monitoren en analyseren van de supply chain op basis van beschikbare data/informatie. Hierop ben je concrete verbeterpunten/acties aan het baseren. Goede communicatie met commercie m.b.t. relevante ontwikkelingen van de voorraad (OOS, forecast etc.) is erg belangrijk. Je verbindt de organisatie strategie met die van leveranciers en eindklanten en draagt zorg voor een goede flow van de eigen merken (op het gebied van kwaliteit en voorraadbeheer). De Supply Chain Analyst zorgt samen met zijn/haar directe collega voor een correct en volledig inkoop & voorraadbeheer en een betrouwbaar en soepel logistiek proces, ten einde bij te dragen aan de realisatie van de organisatiedoelen. Je rapporteert aan de Financial Manager. Taken en verantwoordelijkheden: Het bestaande inkoopbeleid analyseren en hierover rapporteren. KPI's vaststellen (in overleg met Financial Manager) en bewaken. Contracten afsluiten met geselecteerde leveranciers (logistieke partners en enkele wijnleveranciers). Leveranciersrelaties onderhouden en de gemaakte afspraken controleren. Inkoop verzorgen van onze bulkwijnen en wijnen van de kleinere leveranciers. Als back-up fungeren voor de Supplychain manager. Verbeterprocessen leiden en de implementatie van verbeteringen faciliteren. Overleg met commercie m.b.t. forecasting, actuele voorraad en voorraadprognoses. Overleg met Financial Manager. Het waarborgen van de kwaliteit van onze eigen merken, waarbij nauw contact is met brandmanagement. Monitoren voorraadontwikkeling en signaleren risico's. De organisatie bestaat al sinds 1823 één van de oudste wijn en gedistilleerd distributeurs in de Nederlandse markt Profiel Als Supply Chain Analyst ben je in staat een sparringpartner te zijn voor sales en altijd opzoek naar optimalisatie. Qua persoon denk je altijd in oplossingen. Verder ben je sterk commercieel, strategisch en analytisch onderlegd en in staat om een heldere vertaalslag naar de praktijk te maken. Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden: schakelen met diverse interne afdelingen, maar ook in staat om anderen te adviseren en overtuigen. Ervaring binnen de FMCG en/of Food Retail is handig maar geen must. Dit vul je aan met: HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau Opleiding in richting van logistiek, supplychain management of inkoop is een pré Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in supplychain management Ervaring met tools om data te verwerken (bijv. uitstekende kennis van excel) Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift Aanbod Walraven Sax biedt de Supply Chain Analyst een uitdagende functie bij een één van de oudste wijn en gedistilleerd distributeurs in de Nederlandse markt. Een bedrijf met een open en ondernemende cultuur, korte communicatielijnen en een informele werksfeer. Walraven Sax biedt goede arbeidsvoorwaarden conform de CAO Drankenindustrie en groothandel in Dranken en een professionele werkomgeving met focus op (proces)verbetering.

Talespin is building the platform to transform talent development and skill alignment for the future of work. Our spatial computing products deliver a new standard for learning and workforce data, empowering organizations, and individuals to make better talent and career decisions. We're looking for an experienced Product Owner for our authorizing tools team to help drive our mission to transform the way humans learn, work, and collaborate. We are looking for a highly motivated, agile, and experienced Product Owner. You will report directly to the Product Manager, and will be responsible to contribute to the program vision, continuously improve product quality and value, while managing those strategic goals into actionable tasks. You will work with stakeholders across the organization to map and manage requirements and priorities in the backlog for cross-functional teams (both internal and external). The Product Owner will be responsible to manage deliverables through each stage of the development process from design and prototype through deployment and maintenance. The ideal candidate will have systems, design and coding experience, to compliment their exceptional organizational and leadership skills. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! In This Role You Will: Create stories, epics, and themes and ensure work priorities are aligned with product strategies to deliver maximum user value. Take personal accountability for ensuring that team actions and backlog are consistently and fully aligned to the technical needs, strategic needs, and objectives of the business and/or client(s). Document product technical requirements for the development and IT organization in line with market problems communicated by the product leadership, and collaborate with the development team to ensure backlog (tickets and Epics) contain the necessary detail to ensure efficient prioritization, coding, testing, and client validation. Regularly prioritize, monitor, and track progress of the team backlog and commitments against targets, communicating this with the team to manage expectations and suggest additional support when needed. Present complex information and ideas through open, transparent communication to engender trust and ensure mutual understanding. Gather additional insight directly from the client and other external sources of expert information to offer unique and current perspectives on the overall product vision and backlog. Be an expert at identifying and acting against complex and distant potential road blockers, holding team members accountable for identifying and addressing individual road blockers to personal progress. Consistently demonstrate excellent technical knowledge and proficiency, sharing this with others in their team to improve performance. Consistently demonstrates effective time management across challenging and overlapping projects, supporting others in the team with managing their schedule. Lead Backlog Grooming and Sprint Review sessions, while making sure to attend all other sprint events as an active participant. Bring commercial expertise, sound business judgment, and draws on external sources to prioritize and help reshape the product vision and road map. Establish and keep to budgets and resources available that align with other departments.  What We Look For in a Candidate: Bachelor's (BA or BS) in business, computer science, or related field Minimum of five years' previous experience as a Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Analyst, or in a related field. Prior experience working in a technology start-up environment In-depth understanding of Agile methodologies, technical understanding of products, and up-to-date on industry standards and best practices Experience with Jira and Confluence High sense of urgency and ability to work well in and navigate a matrix environment. Effectively interface with development, business, analytics, operations, systems, and marketing personnel. Excellent leadership and decision-making skills. Advanced oral and strong written communication skills. Advanced product management, project management, and organizational skills. All applicants must have EU citizenship, or an EU work permit.

I&A Business Manager Location: Hofplein – Rotterdam Fulltime Local conditions apply Are you ready to take the next great step in your career? Are you ready to join a dynamic world-class team? Are you looking for a job where you are fully responsible for developing advanced solutions that drive value to the business? Are you ready to work at the core of Unilever processes and have the freedom to bring great initiatives to the table? Are you ready to build the future of Unilever? If you are a dynamic, highly motivated, energetic and friendly individual with a strong background in technology, we’re looking for you! If you feel comfortable working in an agile team and drive value to the business, we’re looking for you! If you have a proven track record in using technology to shape the future of the products you are involved in, we’re looking for you! If you want to change the status quo and don’t settle for less than a great outcome, we’re looking for you! Background In this role you will work as part of the Unilever Benelux organization. Within the Information & Analytics (I&A) team we work to provide the wings for business to fly. One of the wings being high quality data & analysis. Being a member of the I&A team is working towards on creating one version of the truth and providing easily reachable answers of top business questions within Benelux organization. The 4 principles driving I&A are; end-to-end ownership maximized automation one version of the truth continuous improvement With our ambitious digital I&A agenda, we are focusing on different aspect. Creating backend solutions to fully automated end-2-end processes. But also working on frontend products to help colleagues to drive insights. JOB SUMMARY The link between the business teams (Marketing, Sales, Finance & Supply Chain) and the data engineers / system key users, solving both day-to-day and longer-term business questions. You are directly involved in building the technical solution. Ensure that the organization can work with one version of the truth and sustain the confidence on the data, whilst establishing a trusted, simple and intuitive user experience. YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for the ways business teams analyze their problems and support their decision making via data driven tooling. You need to be critical on the current ways of working and be able to challenge yourself to come up with better, faster and more holistic (covering the angles from SC, Finance and CD) and therefore better solutions. Responsible for managing and delivering projects end to end, from feasibility to implementation and deployment across the organization – together with the more data driven part of the team. Play active role in the financial month end close process and be able to present financial results to business teams and in different meeting forums. Play an active role in bringing the entire MCO up to speed on new technologies and ways of working (more data driven and value oriented) - you are the filter on what question / information is relevant and what is not. Initiate the development of new or changing/improving existing systems, processes and formats. Play an active role in executing and continuously improving of recurring processes (I.e. planning / forecast / RSP tracking). Improve business teams’ decision making processes by supporting them with the right tooling (e.g. Power BI) and by driving the change towards fact based decision making on those things that matter. Optimize time spent in business teams by understanding key information processes throughout the organization and propose different ways of working by leveraging optimal use of data and systems. Coach, guide and develop other data analysts. KEY REQUIREMENTS SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 4 Years of experience in analyzing data Master in Business (Finance, SC, Business) or Data/information management Fluent English and Dutch communication skills, verbal & written Proven ability to quickly read (business) processes and good understanding of business questions and challenges Proven ability to translate business questions into a technical solution and the other way around: be the link between business and technical experts Proven experience Excel (i.e. VBA), Power Query and Power BI development Experience with programming languages like Python Financial knowledge and experience with profit & loss and management reporting is an advantage COMPETENCIES Practical creativity Analytical ability Enterprising behavior Leading others Ability to learn Excited about the role? To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application. Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

About ViCentra  ViCentra is an innovative medical device company which focuses on the research and development, manufacturing and commercialisation of a ground-breaking device for the management of diabetes. Kaleido, the smallest and lightest insulin pump system currently available, is designed to help people with diabetes live life on their own terms:  "For us, super accurate insulin delivery and improved control are non-negotiables, but discretion, simplicity and choice is our way of helping you live life in your own way"  Driven by ViCentra's desire to be meaningfully different, Kaleido aims to reduce the impact that diabetes can have on daily life. Utilizing Bluetooth wireless technology, Kaleido infuses colour and choice into the market, networking its hybrid patch pumps and handsets into a broader family of easy-to-use products and data services to create a customer-focused, integrated diabetes support service.  The position  As the Supply Chain Analyst you will define and execute the inventory strategy to ensure product availability to meet customer requirements. Delivering in line with the business Supply Chain strategies and processes you will balance demand to ensure volumes are within the targeted solution. Collaborating cross-functionally with Sales/ Marketing, Distribution, Finance, Customer Care, Regulatory & Quality you will lead category strategy, cost reduction initiatives, lead time forecasting and on-time delivery, quality, supplier performance, supplier consolidation/ rationalization and improve on vendor relationships.  Main Responsibilities  Review business forecast and create purchasing and production plans. Develop and monitor KPIs to measure production and supplier performance, issue and distribute reports to management. Manage vendor relationships and drive year-over-year performance improvements with quality, delivery, costs. Drive continuous improvements to achieve cost targets. Define and manage winning category strategies and approaches with suppliers. Act independently to prescribe methods and innovative approaches on new and special assignments. Support goals and objectives as established by management. Ensure master data is set in alignment with distribution strategy. Provide program ownership and governance for the maintenance of accurate planning lead times.  The ideal candidate to join our team  To be successful in this role, you are a natural problem solver with strong analytical skills and a pro-active, hands-on mentality. You have a drive for execution and results with a clear focus on customer satisfaction. You are a team player, who’s able to build lasting relationships with colleagues in other departments and disciplines. Able to work under pressure, managing several tasks and projects at once poses no problem for you.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferably in Supply Chain/ Finance/ Business Administration/ Engineering Professional experience within Supply Chain, Planning or related function End to end supplier/contract manufacturer experience Experienced in KPI and performance setting  Abilities  Advanced Microsoft Excel User Highly adaptable and able to work in a fast paced environment Plans effectively and works well in a team or individually Strategic thinker with hands-on mentality Fast learner who is able to work independently Solution focused with a high level of self-motivation, drive and tenacity Able to communicate effectively with good listening skills Fluent written and spoken English. Dutch language is not required. Ability to work with little supervision  It’s a bonus if you also have:  Supply chain experience within the medical devices/ MedTech industry Project Management and Six-Sigma methodologies Certification from the Institute of Supply Management (C.P.M.) / CIPS / APICS or equivalent  What we offer  In addition to working on a ground breaking new product, you’ll be working in a small, friendly and highly motivated team; all ideas are welcomed and great work is rewarded. We’re also offering:  Competitive salary Defined benefit pension + disability insurance Competitive relocation package and assistance (as applicable) Assistance for the preferential 30% tax ruling application if applicable 25 days’ holiday per year (pro rata) + up to 13 ADV (time for time) days + 8 optional purchase days Flexible working, full time (40 hours per week) 8 hours per day to be worked anytime between 07:00 to 19:00 Monday to Friday Contribution towards commuting costs (as applicable) A work environment where you can develop your skills, learn from the best and be rewarded for your imagination Free, on-site parking Social events and team lunches Creative office vibe with a picnic area, beanbags and ping pong table Informal dress code, we’re all about wearing flip-flops in the summer and boots in the winter! Meaningful work with the opportunity to make a difference  Even More! Working in Utrecht you will be working in one of The Netherlands oldest cities with a beautiful medieval centre arranged around canals. Recently voted the most vibrant city in the country (with the largest University in The Netherlands) it is the fourth largest city in the country. It is situated in the centre of the country 48km south of Amsterdam (27 minutes by train) and as such is within easy travel of a number of cities and sights. Moreover, we have a word hard/ play hard approach and believe in creating a fun, exciting work environment so ping pong breaks, team lunches and outings are usual. The free coffee and snacks help too!  Apply today  To apply please use the link below. For more information, please email the above address or call Sarah Lee on +31 (0) 88 3232 896.  **We will start interviewing successful candidates without delay, therefore please submit your CV as soon as possible. If we like what we see we will contact you, if we don’t contact you within 4 weeks we’ve probably proceeded with other candidates but don’t lose heart as we might reach out to you if we have a different role or project we think might be a match**  ViCentra is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. Due to the international nature of the Company applications are only accepted in English.  Agencies: Please note ViCentra is committed to sourcing candidates directly and as such we do not accept speculative CV’s from agencies. We do however work with an approved list of preferred suppliers but in line with our Preferred Supplier List we only pay agency fees where we have a signed agreement in place and a position has formally been placed with the agency by a member of the HR team. We do not pay fees where speculative and unsolicited CV’s are submitted to ViCentra or ViCentra employees. Where this is not observed ViCentra reserves the right to contact these candidates directly and initiate discussions without payment of any agency fee.

Amsterdam - In deze rol als Senior Data Analist werk jij met de gouden bergen aan data die de miljoenenpublieken van de Volkskrant, Trouw, Parool, Humo en de Morgen, en onze andere merken genereren. Met jouw insights verbeter jij de ervaring van miljoenen bezoekers in Nederland en België. Daarmee bouw je aan de toekomst van de sterke media die onze samenleving nodig heeft.  Wat ga jij doen Als senior product analist binnen de afdeling Product Analytics and Insights (B2C) bij onze grootste merken speel je een cruciale rol in de doorontwikkeling van de publicatieplatformen van DPG Media. Je haalt inzichten uit alle beschikbare data over het gebruik van zowel de website als de mobiele apps. Hiermee leg je de basis voor alle beslissingen die in de organisatie genomen worden. Jouw analyses hebben grote impact op de koers van deze merken! Ook wordt er van je verwacht dat je een leidende rol pakt in het data- en impactgedreven werken binnen de merken. Hierin werk je samen met verschillende teams (o.a. IT, Product, Marketing & Redactie).  Jouw hoofdverantwoordelijkheden bestaan uit: Het volgen van bezoekers over de site en apps en hun gedrag in kaart brengen. Onderzoeken of nieuwe product features het beoogde gebruik en gedrag tot gevolg hebben. Je rapporteert je bevindingen aan de organisatie, helpt met het vormen van KPI's en motiveert iedereen om met data resultaten te halen. Daarbij ga je proactief op zoek naar de belangrijkste behoeften in de organisatie om te kunnen sturen op het leveren van de meeste waarde. Op basis daarvan kom je met analyses, modellen, (A/B-)experimenten en nieuwe (algoritmische) oplossingen. Wij bieden Een goed salaris afhankelijk van leeftijd en ervaring. Laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Keuzebudget van 12% (waarvan 8% vakantiegeld). 24 vakantiedagen, met optie tot bijkopen. Jaarlijkse winstregeling (o.b.v. resultaat van de organisatie). Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden d.m.v. opleidingen, trainingen en certificaten. Het werken met ‘state of the art’ analysetechnieken in AWS met ongekend grote datasets.  Wie ben jij Jij hebt een aantoonbaar statistisch en zakelijk inzicht en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden. Je bent in staat om complexe data op een eenvoudige wijze over te brengen aan alle stakeholders in de organisatie. Ook heb je de technische skills die nodig zijn om dieper te kunnen graven, terwijl je oog houdt voor het grotere plaatje. Verder heb jij: Tenminste 2 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare digitale rol. Sterke query skills; dagelijks ontwikkel je en doe je custom analyses met onze back-end & front-end data tools (oa. Amazon, Redshift, Looker). Aantoonbare werkervaring met relationele databases en SQL. Ervaring met geavanceerde en voorspellende modelleringstechnieken (R/Python) is een grote pre. De energie om collega's te motiveren en te enthousiasmeren om met data resultaat te halen. Zelfstartend en de eigenschap om altijd overzicht te houden, de juiste vragen te stellen en verbanden te zien. Een pragmatische focus om met de juiste analyse-technieken grote business impact te maken.  Nog meer redenen om bij DPG Media te willen werken Bij DPG Media werken we voor meer dan 90 sterke nieuwsmerken, magazines, televisieprogramma’s, radiostations en online services zoals Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle en VTM. We lijken misschien een mediagroep, maar we zijn eigenlijk een tech-bedrijf: het IT-team is leidend in onze digitale transformatie. We bieden je een professionele tech-werkomgeving waarin we vrijheid enorm belangrijk vinden: van het kiezen van je device tot het werken aan je toekomst. Voel je vrij om bij ons ondernemer, leerling en teamspeler te zijn, maar vooral jezelf. Bij DPG Media is iedereen welkom. Dus solliciteer, wat je achtergrond ook is. Er staan honderden slimme tech-collega’s te popelen om je op te nemen in hun team, of dat nou een projectteam, een pubquizteam of een sportteam is. Ontdek wat wij je te bieden hebben. En, als je toch bezig bent, vind je ons ook op LinkedIn en Twitter.  Word jij binnenkort onze nieuwe collega?  Solliciteer dan nu! Eerst nog wat meer weten? Ik beantwoord graag je vragen via venetia.de.wit@dpgmedia.nl.  Wij doen graag onze werving zelf en wensen niet samen te werken voor de invulling van deze rol

Position Title: Support Analyst Department: Cloud & Support Services Reports to: Director, Support Services Position Summary The Support Analyst is a member of BluJay Solutions Support Services Team, responsible for working with BluJay’s customers and resellers to manage and resolve incidents and issues relating to our products and integration tools. Primary activities include issue diagnosis, troubleshooting, and incident management. The Support Analyst will use strong problem-solving skills, combined with excellent communication and customer focus, to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.  Essential Functions/Responsibilities Respond to contact from customers, resellers, and professional service engineers, via phone, email and electronic incident submission. Effectively interact with customers of all ability levels to understand the customer’s request and rapidly assess severity level. Define, research, and resolve customer issues in a timely accurate manner, routing nontechnical issues to appropriate BluJay’s personnel using approved business processes. Provides timely updates to the customer, coworkers, and management on the status of outstanding issues. Maintain status of issues in the call-tracking system and performs appropriate follow-up on escalated issues. Documents complex issue resolutions for both the customer and internal reference, following the appropriate support process. Serves as a subject matter expert (SME) and reviewer in the development of documentation and training materials. Assists senior team members with complex issues to gain experience and exposure to more advanced problems. Conveys customer feedback to appropriate business areas such as Marketing, Product Management and Development. Assist in the training and development of Customer Support Analysts. Contribute, review and maintain knowledge base content on an ongoing basis. Performs other duties as needed Participates in 24x7 call rotation Ability to perform all functions associated with the Support Analyst position Other tasks and activities as assigned.  Required Education/Experience & Skills Familiarity with Customs brokerage, shipping automation software, the transportation industry is a plus Moderate understanding of databases and database management systems (SQL, MySQL, Oracle) Proficient in Microsoft Operating Systems and/or similar technologies. Demonstrated successful customer service experience with the ability to manage complex customer issues with calm, comfort, and ease Strong troubleshooting and support skills, including the ability to creatively utilize all available resources to satisfy customer Ability to take ownership of complex issues/assignments and follow through to completion Demonstrates aptitude to prioritize and handle multiple issues simultaneously Effective oral and written communication skills Strong attention to detail and accuracy Ability to work independently in a fast paced technical environment Ability to function and contribute in a team environment Effective time management and project management skills Must be willing to work flexible hours Minimum of 2 years’ experience working in a technical support environment Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred Microsoft Office Suite com or other Support call tracking systems Basic understanding of Internet and networking technologies Familiarity with a programming language
